hymn.title: O Love divine, how sweet Thou art

layout.singingstanza: O Love di -- vine, how sweet Thou art, When shall I find my will -- ing heart All tak -- en up by Thee? My thirst -- y spir -- it faints to prove The great -- ness of re -- deem -- ing love, The love of Christ to me.

lyrics.stanza: O Love divine, how sweet Thou art, When shall I find my willing heart All taken up by Thee? My thirsty spirit faints to prove The greatness of redeeming love, The love of Christ to me.
Stronger His love than death and hell, Its riches are unsearchable: The first-born sons of light Desire in vain its depths to see; They cannot reach the mystery, The length, and breadth, and height.
